data.title: Grateful Dead Family Discography: Crosby, Stills and Nash Box Set
data.text:
Crosby, Stills and Nash Box Set

Crosby, Stills and Nash

Initial release : 1991

Atlantic 82319

Four CD box set that includes tracks taken from Crosby, Stills and Nash group and solo albums. Jerry Garcia, Bill Kreutzmann and Phil Lesh contribute to tracks on this compilation.

Tracks

Disc 1

Suite: Judy Blue Eyes (Stills)

Helplessly Hoping (Stills)

You Don't Have to Cry (Stills)

Wooden Ships (Crosby / Kantner / Stills)

Guinnevere (Crosby)

Marrakesh Express (Nash)

Long Time Gone (Crosby)

Blackbird (Lennon / McCartney)

Lady of the Island (Nash)

Song with No Words (Tree with No Leaves) (Crosby)

Almost Cut My Hair (Crosby)

Teach Your Children (Nash)

Horses Through a Rainstorm (Nash / Reid)

Deja Vu (Crosby)

Helpless (Young)

4 + 20 (Stills)

Laughing (Crosby)

Carry on / Questions (Stills)

Disc 2

Woodstock (Mitchell)

Ohio (Young)

Love the One You're With (Stills)

Our House (Nash)

Old Times Good Times (Stills)

Lee Shore (Crosby)

I'd Swear There Was Somebody Here (Crosby)

Man in the Mirror (Nash)

Black Queen (Stills)

Military Madness (Nash)

I Used to Be a King (Nash)

Simple Man (Nash)

Southbound Train (Nash)

Just a Song Before I Go (Nash)

Disc 4

Southern Cross (Curtis / Curtis / Stills)

Daylight Again: Daylight Again / Find The Cost Of Freedom (Stills)

Thoroughfare Gap (Stills)

Dear Mr. Fantasy (Capaldi / Winwood / Wood)

Got It Made (Stills / Young)

50 / 50 (Lala / Stills)

Delta (Crosby)

After the Dolphin (Doerge / Nash)

Find the Cost of Freedom (Stills)

Musicians

David Crosby - guitar, keyboards, vocals, harmonica

Graham Nash - organ, guitar, harmonica, piano, percussion, vocals, harmonica, fender rhodes

Stephen Stills - organ, guitar, banjo, bass, percussion, piano, keyboards, vocals, vibes

Neil Young - guitar, bass, harmonica, piano, vocals, vibes

Other musicians on this compilation box set include;

Dana Africa - flute

Pat Arnold - vocals

John Barbata - drums, percussion

Richard T Bear - keyboards

Tony Beard - percussion programming

Joel Bernstein - piano, guitar, vocals

Jack Casady - bass

Gloria Coleman - vocals

Tony Concepcion - trumpet

Rita Coolidge - vibes, vocals

Larry Cox - whiskers

George Cricker - trombone

Donnie Dacus - guitar, vocals

Al Degooyer - trumpet

Laurence Dermer - keyboards

Henry Diltz - vocals

Craig Doerge - keyboards, synthesizer

Tim Drummond - bass

Brenda Eager - vocals

Chris Ethridge - bass

Cyrus Faryar - bouzouki

Vanetta Fields - vocals

Mike Finnigan - keyboards, vocals

Mike Fisher - percussion

Joe Galdo - percussion

Jerry Garcia - pedal steel

Art Garfunkel - vocals

Bob Glaub - bass

Wayne Goodwin - fiddle

Jimmy Gordon - drums

Al Gould - fiddle

Paul Harris - keyboards

Michael Hedges - guitar, vocals

Jimi Hendrix - guitar

Chris Hillman - guitar, vocals

James Newton Howard - keyboards

Conrad Isedor - drums

Priscilla Jones - vocals

Ben Keith - acoustic lap steel

Cleo Kennedy - vocals

Carole King - keyboards

Clydie King - vocals

Danny Kortchmar - guitar

Bill Kreutzmann - drums

Russel Kunkel - percussion

Joe Lala - percussion, vocals

Mike Landau - guitar

Paul Lee - drums

Phil Lesh - bass

Maurice Levy - vocals

David Lindley - fiddle, mandolin, guitar

Branford Marsalis - saxophone

Dave Mason - guitar

Shirley Matthews - vocals

Joni Mitchell - vocals

Dorothy Morrison - vocals

Freddie Neil - vocals

Jimmy Page - guitar

Bruce Palmer - bass

Dean Parks - guitar

Al Perkins - pedal steel, guitar, vocals

George Perry - bass

Greg Reeves - bass

Dorian Rudnytsky - cello

John Sambataro - vocals

Calvin Samuels - bass

Timothy B Schmit - vocals

John Sebastian - harmonica, vocals

Leland Sklar - bass

Michael Stergis - guitar

Dallas Taylor - drums, tambourine

James Taylor - guitar, vocals

Efrain Toro - percussion

Joe Vitale - vibes, organ, keyboards, flute, drums, vocals

The Volume Dealers Choir - vocals

Rand Weatherwax - sound design

Jeff Whittaker - congas

Tubby Ziegler - drums

Garcia, Lesh and Kreutzmann play on Laughing which is taken from David Crosby's If I Could Only Remember My Name....;

David Crosby - guitar, vocals

Jerry Garcia - pedal steel

Bill Kreutzmann - drums

Phil Lesh - bass

Joni Mitchell - vocals

Graham Nash - vocals

Garcia and Lesh play on I Used To Be A King which is taken from the Graham Nash album Songs for Beginners;

Johnny Barbata - drums

David Crosby - guitar

Jerry Garcia - pedal steel

Phil Lesh - bass

Graham Nash - guitar, vocals

Neil Young - piano

Garcia plays on Teach Your Children which is taken from the CSNY LP Deja Vu;

David Crosby - vocals

Jerry Garcia - pedal steel

Graham Nash - guitar, tambourine, vocals

Stephen Stills - guitar, bass, vocals

Dallas Taylor - tambourine

Garcia plays on Southbound Train from the Crosby, Nash album Graham Nash/David Crosby;

Johnny Barbata - drums

David Crosby - guitar, vocals

Chris Ethridge - bass

Jerry Garcia - pedal steel

Graham Nash - guitar, vocals

Garcia also possibly plays on Change Partners (from Stephen Stills 2, Stephen Stills, 1973);

Note that Garcia is not credited for this track on this compilation or on the original LP. However the track is included on the Crosby, Stills and Nash compilation Replay and he is credited there.

No musician credit is given for pedal steel on the original album or on this compilation but there is a pedal steel guitar on the track.

However the information given in this compilation indicates that the track was recorded in London which given the Dead's extensive touring in 1972 or 1973 would limit the possibility of Garcia being present, except of course if recorded during the Dead's European tour in spring 1972. (No recording date is given in the notes)

Musicians listed for Change Partners on the Replay compilation;

Stephen Stills - guitar, keyboards, bass, vocals

David Crosby - vocals

Jerry Garcia - pedal steel

Conrad Isidore - drums

Graham Nash - vocals

Dallas Taylor - drums

Musicians listed for Change Partners on the Box Set;

Stephen Stills - guitar, keyboards, vocals

David Crosby - vocals

Henry Diltz - vocals

Paul Harris - keyboards

Freddie Neil - vocals

Calvin Samuels - bass

Dallas Taylor - drums

Credits

Recording information and individual producer / engineer credits are given for each track in this compilation. Only those for the tracks that include members of the Grateful Dead are included here.

Teach Your Children;

Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C on October 24, 1969

Producers - Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young

Engineer - Bill Halverson

Laughing;

Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C on October 24, 1969

Producer - David Crosby

Engineer - Stephen Barncard

Engineering assistant - Ellen Burke

I Used To Be King;

Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C on January 9, 1971

Producer - Graham Nash

Engineer - Stephen Barncard

Mixing - Glyn Johns

Southbound Train;

Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C on January 6, 1972

Producer - David Crosby, Graham Nash, Bill Halverson

Engineer - Bill Halverson

Engineering assistant - Doc Storch

Change Partners;

Recorded at Island Studios, London

Producers - Stephen Stills, Bill Halverson

Engineer - Bill Halverson

For the box set compilation;

Produced by - Graham Nash, Gerry Tolman

Compiled by - Crosby, Stills and Nash, Gerry Tolman, Yves Beauvais

Additional research - Joel Bernstein

Tape archivist - Miguel Pous

Remixing - Stephen Barncard

Digital transfer - Joe Gastwirt, John Knowland

Digital remastering - Joe Gastwirt, John Modell

Tape restoration - Joe Gastwirt, John Knowland, Joel Bernstein

Photography - Joel Bernstein, Henry Diltz, Graham Nash/Harris Harris, Neal Preston

Memorabilia courtesy of Scott Oxman Archives

Quotes researched and compiled by - Raymond Foye, Joel Bernstein, Ron Scarlett, Francesco Lucarelli

Art direction - Bob Defrin

Design - Lynn Kowalewski

Notes

The box set is dedicated to;

"...the loving memory of Cass Elliot, without whom most of this music may never have been made

Related releases

Teach Your Children is taken from;

Deja Vu, Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young, 1970

Laughing is taken from;

If I Could Only Remember My Name...., David Crosby, 1971

I Used to Be a King is taken from;

Songs for Beginners, Graham Nash, 1971

Southbound Train is taken from;

Graham Nash/David Crosby, Nash and Crosby, 1972

Change Partners is taken from;

Stephen Stills 2, Stephen Stills, 1971

This is a compilation of previously released and unreleased songs. The sources for the all the tracks are as follows;

Suite: Judy Blue Eyes, 4 + 20, Woodstock - unreleased alternate mix, 1969

Helplessly Hoping, Blackbird, Song with No Words (Tree with No Leaves) - unreleased live studio versions, 1969

You Don't Have to Cry - unreleased first recording, 1968

Wooden Ships, Marrakesh Express, Long Time Gone, Lady of the Island - originally released on Crosby, Stills and Nash, Crosby, Stills and Nash, 1969

Guinnevere - unreleased early demo, 1968

Almost Cut My Hair - unreleased unedited original version

Teach Your Children, Deja Vu, Helpless, Carry on / Questions, Our House - originally released on Deja Vu, Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young, 1970

Horses Through a Rainstorm - unreleased song, 1969

Laughing, Music Is Love, I'd Swear There Was Somebody Here - originally released on If I Could Only Remember My Name...., David Crosby, 1971

Ohio, Find the Cost of Freedom - originally released as a single, Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young, 1970

Love the One You're With, Old Times Good Times - originally released on Stephen Stills, Stephen Stills, 1970

Lee Shore - unreleased version, 1969 (1991 overdubs)

Man in the Mirror - unreleased liver version, 1970

Black Queen - unreleased live version, 1970

Military Madness, I Used to Be a King, Chicago / We Can Change the World - originally released on Songs for Beginners, Graham Nash, 1971

Urge for Going - unreleased version, 1971

Simple Man - unreleased alternate mix, 1970

Southbound Train, Immigration Man, Where Will I Be?, Page 43 - originally released on Graham Nash/David Crosby, Nash and Crosby, 1972

Change Partners, Word Game - originally released on Stephen Stills 2, Stephen Stills, 1971

My Love Is a Gentle Thing, Turn Back the Pages - unreleased songs, 1975

Johnny's Garden, So Begins the Task, It Doesn't Matter - originally released on Manassas, Manassas, 1972

See the Changes - unreleased version, 1973

Homeward Through the Haze - unreleased version, 1974

Carry Me, Cowboy of Dreams, Bittersweet, To the Last Whale... Critical Mass, Wind on the Water - originally released on Wind On The Water, Nash and Crosby, 1975

Prison Song, Another Sleep Song, Wild Tales - originally released on Wild Tales, Graham Nash, 1974

Taken It All - unreleased CSN and Y version, 1976

In My Dreams, Just a Song Before I Go, Shadow Captain, Cathedral, Cold Rain - originally released on CSN, Crosby, Stills and Nash, 1977

Dark Star - originally released on Allies, Crosby, Stills and Nash, 1983

Wasted on the Way, Southern Cross, Daylight Again (Daylight Again / Find The Cost Of Freedom), Delta - originally released on Daylight Again, Crosby, Stills and Nash, 1982

Barrel of Pain (Half-Life) - originally released on Earth And Sky, Graham Nash, 1980

Thoroughfare Gap - originally released on Thoroughfare Gap, Stephen Stills, 1978

Dear Mr. Fantasy - unreleased version, 1980

Got It Made - unreleased version, 1988

Tracks in the Dust - originally released on Oh Yes I Can, David Crosby, 1989

As I Come of Age - unreleased version, 1981

50 / 50 - originally released on Right By You, Stephen Stills, 1984

Drive My Car - unreleased version, 1978

Soldiers of Peace - unreleased version, 1988

Yours and Mine, Haven't We Lost Enough?, After the Dolphin - originally released on Live It Up, Crosby, Stills and Nash, 1990

Buy from amazon.com
